page.title: 09FARMING IN BORDON.
page.content: Farming in the Bordon area is limited by the soil. Most of the area is covered by a very coarse sandstone which leeches out soil nutrients. It is an area of heathland.The farms grew up where alluvium was deposited by the River Wey and further irrigation was perfected in this area by the water meadow system. Bordon has seven farms,most are dairy but some are arable. There are two orchards north_west of Shortheath Common belonging to Rookery Farm. Baker's Farm sells fruit, vegetables and plants. There are plenty of arable fields that grow cereals and corn on the cob. A lot of the crops are sold to local shops. The farming area is mostly north-west of the residential part of Bordon. Most farms branch off the B3004 or B3002.
